--- Cedric Beust <cbeust@...> wrote:


> On 9/19/05, John H. E. <johnemb@...> wrote:
> >
> > OK.
> > Does TestNG support J2ME CDC (Connected Device Configuration)?
> 
> 
> No, TestNG is just a test harness, like JUnit.

I'm guessing you could always use junit.jar on a J2ME CDC device... But
are there any reasons why using the Junit framework/harness on a J2ME CDC
platform/configuration would not work? Anyone?


> But I am very interested in JME testing since I write mobile code all
> day
> long. What is needed is a JME testing harness that would let us drive an
> emulator from Java (simulate keypresses, get the content of the screen,
> etc...).
> 
> I have a few ideas on how to do this, but so far, I haven't had the time
> to
> implement them.
> 
> How about you, how do you test your JME code right now?

I don't, I was just wondering/planning ahead ;)

-- 
John
